title.narrative: Lao (la République démocratique populaire): Aide ciblée aux pays
Lao People's Democratic Republic (the): Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: World Bank : Health Financing/Sustainability

1. Updated analysis of the impact of COVID-19 on routine immunization and health financing and sectoral budget for 2021/2022 conducted; 2. Analysis on the costs of immunization service delivery to inform options for scaling up essential health services including immunization conducted.

target.value: Provide technical assistance to MoH to strengthen capacity on planning for immunisation financing, monitor the impact of COVID-19 on health financing, use evidence for planning and policy making and support learning/advocacy activities involving MoH and MoF for sustainable financing for immunization by focusing on domestic resource mobilization, improving efficiency. 1. TA to support to NIP on strategic costing and health financing for routine immunisation. 2. Assessment of the impact of COVID-19 on health financing including sustainable immunization financing and budget analysis for 2020/2021. 3. Engagement of MoF/MoH officials on domestic resource mobilization and transition readiness discussions through joint learning network and other learning events. 4. Analysis to inform options for scaling up essential health services and assess policy options for mobilizing domestic sources to delivery EHSP including immunization services (fiscal space analysis) to inform sustainability and transition planning.

comment.narrative: (1) Analysis has been regularly updated and the latest update is based on the macro-economic data in the East Asia and Pacific Economic Update, released in October 2021. The update is integrated with NHA data, DHIS2 data for immunization coverage, the revised budget plan for 2021. (2) Given the pressing needs of planning and costing of COVID-19 vaccination, the team has engaged in costing analysis for COVID-19 vaccination, working closely with other development partners such WHO. The preliminary result has been disseminated in September 2021. Furthermore, the WB team has been involved in formulating microplanning for the vaccination, including detailed budgeting and costing analysis for outreach. (3) Engaged representatives from DOF and NHIB in global and regional learning exchanges on domestic resource mobilization and health financing for UHC, including the Joint Learning Network (JLN) and the 5th Meeting of the Montreux Collaborative. Those collaborative meetings help generating and exchanging ideas and lessons for Lao participants and others to facilitate the implementation of the Health Financing Strategy 2021-2025 and Vision 2030 for Lao PDR.

title.narrative: 1. Assessment of the impact of COVID-19 on health financing including sustainable immunization financing and budget analysis for 2020/2021; 2. Engagement of MoF/MoH officials on domestic resource mobilization and transition readiness discussions through joint learning network and other learning events.

target.value: Provide technical assistance to MoH to strengthen capacity on planning for immunisation financing, monitor the impact of COVID-19 on health financing, use evidence for planning and policy making and support learning/advocacy activities involving MoH and MoF for sustainable financing for immunization by focusing on domestic resource mobilization, improving efficiency. 1. TA to support to NIP on strategic costing and health financing for routine immunisation. 2. Assessment of the impact of COVID-19 on health financing including sustainable immunization financing and budget analysis for 2020/2021. 3. Engagement of MoF/MoH officials on domestic resource mobilization and transition readiness discussions through joint learning network and other learning events. 4. Analysis to inform options for scaling up essential health services and assess policy options for mobilizing domestic sources to delivery EHSP including immunization services (fiscal space analysis) to inform sustainability and transition planning.

comment.narrative: (1) Analysis on the early impact of COVID-19 on health financing in Lao PDR was conducted and the report titled ?Building a resilient health system for health emergency: Addressing system constraints for improving financing and service delivery? was published in the Lao Economic Monitor in 2020. The analysis has been regularly updated when the new macro-economic data is released. The next update is planned in September. (2) Engaged representatives from MOF (Budget Department and External Finance and Debt Management Department) and MOH (Department of Finance & National Health Insurance Bureau) in the discussion on Bi-regional Workshop on Health Financing for Universal Health Coverage in Asia & the Pacific beyond COVID-19, focusing on Increasing Domestic Resource Mobilization in February 2021. Engaged DOF representative in the Joint Learning Network COVID-19 Vaccine Financing Event where outputs of COVID-19 vaccine costing case of Lao PDR was presented; Engaged senior officials of DOF & NHIB in the JLN event on the Macro-Fiscal Impact of COVID-19 : A Domestic Resource Mobilization Perspective and the JLN learning course on Budget Execution Learning Exchange.

title.narrative: 1. Continue advocacy for transition and sustainability 2. Support implementation of health financing strategy for domestic resource mobilization and sustainable financing for UHC.

target.value: TA support for mobilizing domestic resources for the health sector including the national immunization program.

comment.narrative: Completed the EHSP costing analysis. The report is submitted for endorsement by the Minister of Health. Continued analysis on policy options for financing ESP scale up and options for mobilizing domestic sources is planned under 2021 TCA.

target.value: TA support for mobilizing domestic resources for the health sector including the national immunization program.

comment.narrative: Completed the EHSP costing analysis. The report is submitted for endorsement by the Minister of Health. Continued analysis on policy options for financing ESP scale up and options for mobilizing domestic sources is planned under 2021 TCA.

title.narrative: WHO : Vaccine-Specific Support
(1) Feasibility and timing of IPV intro and OPV withdrawal is reviewed by NITAG and its meeting minute is available; (2) MR PoA coordination meeting is held and its minute is availble

target.value: NVI (link to HR2-6, HR2-7)- support NITAG and MOH decision making on use of IPV2 and OPV withdrawal; continue implementation of national strategy and plan of action for MR elimination

comment.narrative: (1) MINOR DELAYS - NITAG has been focused on COVID vaccine guidance; Feasibility and timing of IPV intro and OPV withdrawal will be discussed by NITAG in Q1 2022; (2) ON TRACK MR PoA coordination meeting was held on 8 Nov and minutes are available

title.narrative: (1) MR PoA coordination meeting is held and its minute is available

target.value: NVI (link to HR2-6, HR2-7)- support NITAG and MOH decision making on use of IPV2 and OPV withdrawal; continue implementation of national strategy and plan of action for MR elimination

comment.narrative: The MR PoA coordination meeting was held (31 March 2021) and its minute is attached

title.narrative: Post-introduction evaluation completed for HPV dose 1 and 2

target.value: Technical support/NVI (cont'd) to (1) conduct rapid convenience monitoring (RCM) on HPV introduction and post-introduction evaluation protocol development, (2) switch MR presentations (timing tbc), and (3) prepare for introduction of rotavirus vaccine in 2020; (4) Technical assistance in the planning, implementation, and evaluation of MR SIA

comment.narrative: Three teams completed the Lao PDR HPV Post-Vaccine Introduction Evaluation in March and April 2021

target.value: Technical support/NVI (cont'd) to (1) conduct rapid convenience monitoring (RCM) on HPV introduction and post-introduction evaluation protocol development, (2) switch MR presentations (timing tbc), and (3) prepare for introduction of rotavirus vaccine in 2020; (4) Technical assistance in the planning, implementation, and evaluation of MR SIA

comment.narrative: Three teams completed the Lao PDR HPV Post-Vaccine Introduction Evaluation in March and April 2021

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)

(1) Mid-year workplan progress report is available; (2) At least 2 ICC meetings have been convened and minutes are available; (3) Drafting of Gavi Board paper on Lao PDR tailored transition including development of scenarios and analysis of trade-offs; (4) formal scoping of Training centre for ongoing EPI/RMNCAH capacity building completed and agreement on way forward (link to HSS HR-30)

target.value: Technical support and capacity building (link to HR2-11, HR2-14, HR2-15, HR2-16): (1) LMC, governance, programme management including support towards the efficient implementation of annual MCHC workplan (including Gavi HSS workplan) implementation; (2) development of eLearning and roll-out of tools to develop capacity during pre-service and in-service, especially at lowest levels; (3) strategic and operational planning including the translation of the cMYP to an annual operational plan (AOP) that is aligned to other relevant health sector plans

comment.narrative: - June ICC meeting held and Q4 ICC being scheduled. - Drafting of Gavi Board paper on Lao PDR tailored transition including development of scenarios and analysis of trade-offs - has been delayed related to Gavi governance calendar - formal scoping of Training centre for ongoing EPI/RMNCAH capacity building completed and agreement on way forward (link to HSS HR-30)

title.narrative: (1) Annual MCHC workplan is developed with prioritized activities, clear technical leads, DP and financial support; (2) eLearning strategy developed including training materials finalized and to high level of quality and completeness; 2 eLearning tools (TBC AEFI and vaccine hesitancy) are available

target.value: Technical support and capacity building (link to HR2-11, HR2-14, HR2-15, HR2-16): (1) LMC, governance, programme management including support towards the efficient implementation of annual MCHC workplan (including Gavi HSS workplan) implementation; (2) development of eLearning and roll-out of tools to develop capacity during pre-service and in-service, especially at lowest levels; (3) strategic and operational planning including the translation of the cMYP to an annual operational plan (AOP) that is aligned to other relevant health sector plans

comment.narrative: Annual Operational Plan is available and being updated for 2021; training plan and development of materials for University of Health Sciences (UHS) curriculum is underway. WHO CO continues to update the EPI webpage with the most current training materials -- so far in 2021, the focus in on COVID vx training materials https://sites.google.com/view/epilao

target.value: Technical support and capacity building (link to HR2-11, HR2-14, HR2-15, HR2-16): (1) LMC, governance, programme management including support towards the efficient implementation of annual MCHC workplan (including Gavi HSS workplan) implementation; (2) development of eLearning and roll-out of tools to develop capacity during pre-service and in-service, especially at lowest levels; (3) strategic and operational planning including the translation of the cMYP to an annual operational plan (AOP) that is aligned to other relevant health sector plans

comment.narrative: these appear to be June TCA milestones

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain

target.value: Provide oversight for HSS and technical capacity of national and sub-national team in cold chain system and technical assistance to implement GAVI HSS 3 and Top up #2 activities: 1. Coordinate the training of pool of cold chain technicians to execute the country led service bundled project; 2. Follow up evaluation the quality of training for technicians on preventive maintenance, installation, trouble shooting and repair of the new cold chain equipment (CCE); the designated health worker on correct use and preventive maintenance of the new CCE. 3. Plan and Evaluate and participate on random quality survey at the end of the installation (using UNICEF SD methodology). 4. Support MOH to update and maintain the government?s CCEI (cold chain equipment inventory) on an on-going basis and as referenced deliverable for the CCEOP process. 5. Provide technical support to establish and install SMS based Temperature Monitoring System. 6. Mentor, supervise and provide regular training to Center of Excellence for staff at National Store and 6 regional Cold Chain hubs on Cold chain management, preventive and basic maintenance.

comment.narrative: 1. Cold Chain Inventory System system is being updated since the CCE still being delivered. Accurate and up-to-date cold chain equipment inventories (CCEIs) has been developed which is online based, and all CCE which are installed currently being recorded within a health system. Updated CCEI data enable governments to make informed decisions on vaccine distribution and storage, equipment maintenance and repair, routine and campaign immunization planning and procurement. The challenge is maintenance of an updated CCE Inventory which is resource and labor-intensive. Next year NIP will work on adoption a CCEI Information System that was designed and tailored for operation in Lao P.D.R. 2. SMS based Temperature monitoring system developed devices arrived in November and 1 RTMD has been installed, the remaining 5 will be installed in December in all Cold Chain Hubs; 3. In close cooperation with private sector partners, UNICEF developed a training video material on installing cold chain equipment. Online training of cold chain focal points has been completed, and 18 staff have been trained to provide training materials, forms, and reporting templates on the installation of fridges and freezers. 4. All six Cold Chain Hubs and all provinces now fully equipped with Cold Chain Tools.

title.narrative: 1. Five Cold Rooms are installed and operational; 2.Supplied 157 Cold chain equipment are installed and evaluated;

target.value: Technical assistance to Gavi HSS3 objective 4,HTU-4; HR 54, HR-55,HR- 58, HTU-2; Facilitate Validation and execution of Operational Deployment Plan, conducting country specific stakeholder mapping, timely readiness of sites for installation, quality of data and mapping of country specific risk and agree on its management strategy. 1. Provide technical assistance and guidance on technical aspects of CCEs and SDDs, ensuring that the sites are ready and appropriate for the deployment and installation of the equipment. 2. Monitor implementation of preventive maintenance plan as per country application, and monitor deployment and installation of CCEs, in coordination with the Provincial program management teams 3. Prepare a report on the correct deployment of equipment and implementation of the CCEOP project in general. 4. Plan, coordinate and ensure quality of trainings conducted for installation of ILRs and SDDs. Ensure that there is relevant and maximum participation from the cold chain technicians. 5.Assess the technical procedures during installation and report on the process and quality of the installation of the cold chain equipment

comment.narrative: 1. Five cold rooms have been installed and fully functional. It is also report in other milestone. Herewith the private company executive summary report attached and technical description briefly provided. 2. Total of 157 cold chain equipment arrived and currently being distributed by locally recruited logistic company. The list of health facilities and geographical locations are attached. 3. The next shipment of 183 cold chain equipment is planned for July 9, 2021.

title.narrative: 1. Next batch of 720 Cold chain equipment are deployed; 2. Cold chain technicians are trained in basic and preventive maintenance;

target.value: Technical assistance to Gavi HSS3 objective 4,HTU-4; HR 54, HR-55,HR- 58, HTU-2; Facilitate Validation and execution of Operational Deployment Plan, conducting country specific stakeholder mapping, timely readiness of sites for installation, quality of data and mapping of country specific risk and agree on its management strategy. 1. Provide technical assistance and guidance on technical aspects of CCEs and SDDs, ensuring that the sites are ready and appropriate for the deployment and installation of the equipment. 2. Monitor implementation of preventive maintenance plan as per country application, and monitor deployment and installation of CCEs, in coordination with the Provincial program management teams 3. Prepare a report on the correct deployment of equipment and implementation of the CCEOP project in general. 4. Plan, coordinate and ensure quality of trainings conducted for installation of ILRs and SDDs. Ensure that there is relevant and maximum participation from the cold chain technicians. 5.Assess the technical procedures during installation and report on the process and quality of the installation of the cold chain equipment

comment.narrative: 1. Out of 967 CCE, 340 has been distributed and 100 was installed. Currently internal inspection is ongoing. The remaining batch of CCE is expected in March 2022. 2. UNICEF provided technical assistance to the MoH to prepare the submission of the application to COVAX to expand the cold chain capacity of the National Store. The technical project proposal included preparation of expansion design, refurbishment of the national store, procurement, and installation of two (2) Walk-in Cold Rooms. Independent Review Committee has endorsed the technical proposal, and the project implementation process is underway. ? A technical proposal to refurbish and renovate the National Vaccine Store has been submitted to MoH. The bidding process is ongoing, and the renovation is planned to start in February 2022. The procurement of two large volume (40m3) Walk-in Cold Rooms is in the process and expected to arrive in April 2022. ? Due to lockdown, and travel restriction measures imposed by the government, training of cold chain focal points on the installation of cold chain equipment has been postponed; The planned training was designed to be skilled based. The video-training material has been developed, and online training conducted to overcome the travel restriction barrier.

title.narrative: 1. Pool of cold chain technicians are trained on country led service bundled implementation and their capacity is evaluated; 2. Regular PMT is conducted in every province to ensure the Country Led Service Bundled implementation is per agreed timeframe.

target.value: Provide oversight for HSS and technical capacity of national and sub-national team in cold chain system and technical assistance to implement GAVI HSS 3 and Top up #2 activities: 1. Coordinate the training of pool of cold chain technicians to execute the country led service bundled project; 2. Follow up evaluation the quality of training for technicians on preventive maintenance, installation, trouble shooting and repair of the new cold chain equipment (CCE); the designated health worker on correct use and preventive maintenance of the new CCE. 3. Plan and Evaluate and participate on random quality survey at the end of the installation (using UNICEF SD methodology). 4. Support MOH to update and maintain the government?s CCEI (cold chain equipment inventory) on an on-going basis and as referenced deliverable for the CCEOP process. 5. Provide technical support to establish and install SMS based Temperature Monitoring System. 6. Mentor, supervise and provide regular training to Center of Excellence for staff at National Store and 6 regional Cold Chain hubs on Cold chain management, preventive and basic maintenance.

comment.narrative: Total of 12 Cold Chain technicians from each provinces are trained (on the job training due to COVID19 lockdown measures) on installation of cold chain equipment. Two regular PMT is conducted at national level to ensure the Country Led Service Bundled implementation is per agreed timeframe. Provincial PMT is planned in July.

title.narrative: World Bank : Programme Management - General
1. Continue providing TA to health facilities for QPS implementation 2. Monitor the performance and quality through QPS implementation

target.value: TA to HANSA design and implementation, specially on the new quality and performance scorecard (QPS) for health services including immunization

comment.narrative: 1. The SOP for implementing QPS is included in the QPS manual and the QPS tools are at its near-ready status for use with finalization expected in mid-July 2021. 2. The QPS trainings of district assessors are expected to commence in August 2021 subject to the COVID-19 lockdown situation. Field test on QPS tool was carried out by Department of Healthcare and Rehabilitation (DHR) during in 17-21 February 2020. The roll out is pending due to COVID-19 lockdown. Continued TA to HANSA implementation readiness. All expected to be completed by mid July.

target.value: TA to HANSA design and implementation, specially on the new quality and performance scorecard (QPS) for health services including immunization

comment.narrative: 1. The SOP for implementing QPS is included in the QPS manual and the QPS tools are at its near-ready status for use with finalization expected in mid-July 2021. 2. The QPS trainings of district assessors are expected to commence in August 2021 subject to the COVID-19 lockdown situation. Field test on QPS tool was carried out by Department of Healthcare and Rehabilitation (DHR) during in 17-21 February 2020. The roll out is pending due to COVID-19 lockdown. Continued TA to HANSA implementation readiness. All expected to be completed by mid July.

title.narrative: Regular and timely reporting of DLI immunization indicators through the program management dashboards

target.value: Capacity building of national and subnational level staff for regular monitoring and reporting of MCH indicators

comment.narrative: Provided TA for developing dashboard for the 50 low performing districts for immunization coverage and integrated outreach as part of DLI monitoring under HGNDP/HANSA.

target.value: Capacity building of national and subnational level staff for regular monitoring and reporting of MCH indicators

comment.narrative: Provided TA for developing dashboard for the 50 low performing districts for immunization coverage and integrated outreach as part of DLI monitoring under HGNDP/HANSA.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity

1. The guideline on participatory village planning is developed and incorporated into and microplanning guideline as well as the NSEDP village plans; 2; Training modules for HC staff in inter-personal and communication, evidence based planning and monitoring to faciliate use of immunization services at fixed sites is developed; 3. Village drug kit and essential commodities for VHV are identified and customized to village need;
WHO : Health Financing/Sustainability

(1) Training(s) will be organized for NIP staff to strengthen capacity to report on immunization expenditures according to the NHA format through JRF/NHA (SHA) conducted; (2) workshop to finalize the NHA report for 2019 and discuss implications/use of the data for policy decisions; (3) Drafting of Gavi Board paper on Lao PDR tailored transition including development of financial scenarios.

target.value: Immunization financing - Supporting decision making and implementation of HFS in the context of the 9th NSEDP/HSDP; identification of program enhancements and efficiency gains (ie PCV and/or Penta switch to lower-cost/more sustainable vaccine) to ensure smooth transitoin from Gavi

comment.narrative: Beyond a health crisis, the COVID-19 pandemic has exposed the interconnectedness of health and economies and the importance of sufficient investment in health in Lao PDR. GDP growth is projected to be at -0.4% in 2020 and at 4.6% in 2021; general government debt as a share of GDP has been significantly increased with 68.3% in 2021 and 69.1% in 2023. COVID-19 impact on the health sector: Govt budget cuts by 30% in 2020, which will be continued by 2022; -Donor funding for health: $101M in 2019; COVID-19 response plan costing: $181M in 2020; COVID-19 vaccine procurement and deployment cost for 50% of population coverage by 2021: $61.3M ($51.3M for vaccine procurement; $10M for vaccine deployment) Key Progress towards successful donor transition: In 2016, DHIS2 became the reporting tool and system for eight programs to institutionalize integration of multiple subsystems. I. Training(s) will be organized for NIP staff to strengthen capacity to report on immunization expenditures according to the NHA format through JRF/NHA (SHA) conducted; => NHA training workshops were conducted in Xayabouly province in July and in Xiangkhouang and Huaphan provinces in August. During the workshops, how to report in which format for health expenditure in the health sector including immunization expenditure were covered. II. workshop to finalize the NHA report for 2019 and discuss implications/use of the data for policy decisions; => The NHA report 2021 for the year 2019 was finalized including information on immunization expenditure and during the discussions and consultations with Department of Finance and other relevant stakeholders, the implications of the data for policy decisions were discussed and the use of data for policy decisions were emphasized during the meetings and the NHA training workshops. The dissemination meeting of the NHA was postponed due to COVID-19 situation in Lao PDR. (supporting document: NHA final report in Eng and Lao)

title.narrative: ROII' health metrics available - reduction in IM, U5, and cases/disease averted - attributable to immunization

target.value: Return on Investment in Immunization (ROII) (NEW)- using OneHealth or similar tool, support MOH/MCHC to translate 2021-2025 investment in NIP into health impact and link to role of achieving SDGs

comment.narrative: After pilot testing and feasibility analysis of use of Direct Event Capture, it was decided that DEC is not used as it is not fully/practically used. Instead, iER is being used for tracking immunization as alternative.

target.value: Technical assistance to support the implementation of Communication for Immunization Strategic Plan and the implementation to GAVI HSS Objective 3 Communicaiton for development activities. It include: Targeted advocacy meetings, engagement and capacity development of National, Provincial, District Communication Management Committees and mass organizations to address ethnic and demand side barriers; system strengthening and capacity of health managers and providers build on C4D;Faciliated production/ reproduction of audio-video materials.

comment.narrative: 1. Two media briefings at the national level with the involvement of the UN and donor agencies have been held in March and June. One panel meeting COVID19 vaccination specific organized in June. 2. National level advocacy meeting conducted and subsequent Provincial advocacy meetings with mass organizations organized to address the importance of all type of immunization; Particular focus given to ethnic and demand-side barriers are discussed in each provinces selecting the high risk and low performing districts; Facilitators guide, sub-national training materials, agenda of the workshops are attached.

title.narrative: 1. Advocacy workshops are organized in 20 districts are village chiefs are sensitized on local government support for timely immunization and poor performing villages are mapped. 2. Community orientation in selected districts and villages on Fully Immunized Village model completed and started its implementation.

comment.narrative: Due to main focus on COVID19 communication, community mobilization, the activities and milestones will be implemented in 2022. The activities are linked to GAVI HSS 3 activities implementation.

title.narrative: 1. Planning for advocacy workshop for 50 high risk districts and design of mapping. 2. Communication Task Force meeting at National and Province level conducted and the report submitted to CCEH and discussed at monthly EPI meeting before June, 2021

comment.narrative: The recommendations from the evaluation of MNCH Strategic Planning Framework suggested that community mobilization and communication are essential to raise awareness about RMNCAH and motivate health seeking behavior. The Communication for Health Strategy has been in place in which the Center for Communication, Education and Health (CCEH) leads the implementation of the strategy. However, communications for the integrated services on RMNCAH has not been done adequately. Coordination and the involvement of various sectors in communication area is still limited, including lack of coordinating mechanism between the health sector and the non-health sector such as mass organizations that have well-established networks and relationships with communities. Such limitations lead to information about health failing to reach the whole population and difficulty in community mobilization. Therefore, to address this need Communication Taskforce on RMNCAH has been established with a set of roles and responsibilities of members from the health sector and the non-health sectors to work together and contribute towards achieving the goals of RMNCAH in Lao PDR. Though due to COVID19 pandemic and lockdown the main activities of Communication Task Force were focused on Covid19 vaccine introduction, a momentum during World Immunization Week has been build to revive advocacy on routine vaccines.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
Complete end-of-ISDS transition activity review to report on the sustainability of ISDS activities in the 5 implementation provinces implementation in 5 regions

target.value: STOP Immunisation and Surveillance Data Specialist (ISDS) pilot transition, to ensure sustainable improvements in immunization and VPD surveillance data management, quality and use, through sustained supportive supervision

comment.narrative: Scaling up of data strengthening activity using ISDS strategy is underway in two provinces (Savannakhet and Bolikhamxai). In Bolikhamxai it is already started but in Savannakhet it is delayed due to some challenges. To build the capacity of the new selected province staff, different activities were planned. One of these activities was experience-sharing visit. The new province staff travel to old ISDS provinces and visit selected district and HF to gain more experience on ISDS strategy and implementation of ISDS activities. Of the planned two experience sharing visits, the first one was conducted in Vientiane Capital on April 09, 2021. A team of four people from Bolikhamxay province travel to Vientiane capital and visited Sangthong district office and Nachaleun HC. Support on EPI and surveillance data management through on the job training started in Bolikhamxi.

title.narrative: Training conducted on DHIS2 data quality and analysis module to all province EPI manager and statistician/DHIS2 officers

target.value: HMIS (cont'd)- Intensify the efforts to improve the quality and use of data in DHIS2 through additional training on DHIS2 to all provincial EPI managers,surveillance officers,and statistician/DHIS2 officers.

comment.narrative: Scaling up of data strengthening activity using ISDS strategy was planned in two provinces (Savannakhet and Bolikhamxai). Before ground support started, three days training was provided on EPI & surveillance data management, and mentoring/coaching skill to coordinators and implementers of the activity. A total of 23 participants from five provinces (Houaphan, Phongsali, Xainyabouli, Savannakhet and Bolikhamxai) participated in the training. The training targeted DHP head, EPI managers, surveillance officers and statistician from each of the five provinces.

target.value: HMIS (cont'd)- Intensify the efforts to improve the quality and use of data in DHIS2 through additional training on DHIS2 to all provincial EPI managers,surveillance officers,and statistician/DHIS2 officers.

comment.narrative: Scaling up of data strengthening activity using ISDS strategy was planned in two provinces (Savannakhet and Bolikhamxai). The training targeted DHP head, EPI managers, surveillance officers and statistician from each of the five provinces.

title.narrative: AEFI committee has met at least once and minutes are available

target.value: Vaccine safety and security(cont'd)- (1) strengthening AEFI surveillance and management at all levels; (2) development of AEFI workplan and convening of AEFI committee

comment.narrative: in 2021, the AEFI committee has been very active meeting in Feb and May to review serious AEFI investigation and conduct causality assessments. The committee has reviewed and provided input on the national AEFI guideline, adding AEFI management to the guideline and an example of how to fill in the reporting form. WHO is providing technical support to expand capacity at the subnational level to complete thorough investigations and causality assessments. Other updates: ? AEFI committee meeting concluded that the AEFI death case in Setthathirath was a coincidental event and was no associated with vaccines. The case died of congenital heart disease. ? The AEFI after JE case 2 dropped the lawsuit in 2020. ? For Khounkham cases, the meeting suggested an MRI imaging for Khounkham to get a precise diagnosis.

target.value: Vaccine safety and security(cont'd)- (1) strengthening AEFI surveillance and management at all levels; (2) development of AEFI workplan and convening of AEFI committee

comment.narrative: in 2021, the AEFI committee has been very active meeting in Feb and May to review serious AEFI investigation and conduct causality assessments. The committee has reviewed and provided input on the national AEFI guideline, adding AEFI management to the guideline and an example of how to fill in the reporting form. WHO is providing technical support to expand capacity at the subnational level to complete thorough investigations and causality assessments. Other updates: ? AEFI committee meeting concluded that the AEFI death case in Setthathirath was a coincidental event and was no associated with vaccines. The case died of congenital heart disease. ? The AEFI after JE case 2 dropped the lawsuit in 2020. ? For Khounkham cases, the meeting suggested an MRI imaging for Khounkham to get a precise diagnosis.

title.narrative: Updated district level live birth and under 1 estimates are available

target.value: DATA QUALITY II (NEW): Support development of agreed live birth and under 1 estimates for 148 districts using result of Lao Statistics Bureau (LSB) agricultural household survey and mid census data.

comment.narrative: working to identify appropriate TA who can conduct required work at a distance given current COVID travel constraints

title.narrative: UNICEF : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
Strengthen programmatic sustainability through initiating PPP in the area of Immunizaiton

comment.narrative: 1. To strengthen Cold Chain System, a private-public partnership is established for one year to build the capacity of NIP. 2. Village Health Volunteers in Lao PDR interface between the health system and the community and provides the first line of advice and health care to communities and play a central role in the CHSS of the overall PHC strategy. Information on key frontline workers is sketchy and unactionable. VHVs have been recruited by various vertical and development partner-supported projects and have received differential training, supplies, and incentives. There is no national geo-referenced master VHV list ? a complete database with basic information for all VHVs. This information deficit constrains effective planning, management, monitoring, evaluation of VHV work. UNICEF Lao PDR provided technical assistance to a Health Facility and VHV mapping and capacity assessment in one province in Lao PDR to address these crucial gaps in health system information. The mapping exercise was conducted in Bokeo province. The results have been widely shared with the government stakeholders and partners. The VHV/HF mapping will now be expanded to 10 more provinces. 3. Lot Quality Assurance Sampling Survey was carried out in 4 targeted districts (Sanamxay, Xepone, Pha Oudoum, and Bolikhan) in the Attapeua, Savannakhet, Bokeo, and Bolikhamsay provinces in February 2021. The survey conducted by MoH, UNICEF, the Laos Tropical and Public Health Institute (LTPHI), and the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine (LSTM). It aimed to measure the performance of selected Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn, Child, and Adolescent Health (RMNCAH)and nutrition indicators. A follow-up survey is anticipated in one year to assess the extent to which the program is achieving the expected outcomes on DHSS and the key RMNCAH and nutrition indicators. The survey focused on service delivery to the client populations whose knowledge, practices, and health care service accessibility were measured.

title.narrative: Co-financing paid timely by the Government; Correct vaccine forecasting and procurment of vaccine is in plance to keep an optimum level of vaccine stock level

comment.narrative: The Lao government has been sensitized on co-financing commitment and advocacy session have held at higher level on on a trajectory towards financial sustainability. Since the next year will be the last year prior to phasing out of our support and fully self-financing of all vaccines, the government put the immunization as the key strategic program. The Lao PDR is in the process to full cover the left over of co-financing amount before year end. Involving private sector in fund mobilization for COVID19 vaccine, one important involvement the intermediate milestone is also achieved to building private public partnership and involve their contributions of vaccine financing.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Vaccine-Specific Support

target.value: Technical assistance to support the implementation of Communication for Immunization Strategic Plan and the implementation to GAVI HSS Objective 3, HTU 32-33 Communicaiton for development activities; Support Lao PDR in planning, coordination and implementation of vaccine and address vaccine hesitancy: 1. Organize advocacy events/meetings for immunization at different levels, including advocacy with district governors to leverage the subnational support 2. Boost coordination at national level for harmonized social mobilisation work at all level in order to promote demand generation for immunization; 3. Technical assistance and guidance on Media engagement -- including media briefings, field visits to avoid missinformation 4. Provide technical support to MoH to produce and pre-test communication materials for advocacy and community engagement on immunization (including training), such as TV and radio spots, social media content, flyers, flip charts, etc

comment.narrative: The main focus of the government and stakeholders were to support COVID19 vaccination communication. COVAX vaccination communication campaigns also highlighted the routine vaccination. UNICEF in collaboration with CCEH and WHO launched #VaccinateLaos campaign to mark COVID-19 vaccination rollout. Panel discussion organized for media representatives to ensure reporting of the correct and authentic information for communities across Lao PDR. As a part of #VaccinateLaos campaign, communication materials like informative posters, banners, more than 2500 copies of poster, 1 million stickers, 3500 t-shirts have been printed and used for campaign across the country. UNICEF produced 5 videos to focus on promoting COVID-19 vaccination, building trust in safety and effectiveness of vaccines. One of the videos featured the Minister of Health, Lao PDR. The total reach of the videos so far is 71,656 making 84,870 impressions. UNICEF has collaborated with Ms. Aluna THAVONSOUK, a Lao national singer, to produce a song to highlight safety and effectiveness of COVID-19 vaccines leading to the uptake of the vaccination in the country. UNICEF is strategizing community engagement (CE) activities with support from CCEH and its network. To facilitate interactive and participatory approach to communication, a flipchart to talk about COVID-19 and vaccination approach in Lao PDR has been developed . English and Lao versions of the flipchart is part of a toolkit that has been shared with a network of NGOs working on community engagement. To avoid duplication of communication efforts and align with all stakeholders, UNICEF has developed an online CE toolkit. UNICEF with CCEH engaged Lao Front for National Development (LFND) . orient the LFND provincial representatives about various COVID-19 communication tools . This resulted the representatives' targeted approach to improving their community engagement activities.

target.value: Technical assistance to support the implementation of Communication for Immunization Strategic Plan and the implementation to GAVI HSS Objective 3, HTU 32-33 Communicaiton for development activities; Support Lao PDR in planning, coordination and implementation of vaccine and address vaccine hesitancy: 1. Organize advocacy events/meetings for immunization at different levels, including advocacy with district governors to leverage the subnational support 2. Boost coordination at national level for harmonized social mobilisation work at all level in order to promote demand generation for immunization; 3. Technical assistance and guidance on Media engagement -- including media briefings, field visits to avoid missinformation 4. Provide technical support to MoH to produce and pre-test communication materials for advocacy and community engagement on immunization (including training), such as TV and radio spots, social media content, flyers, flip charts, etc

comment.narrative: The report also provided in other milestone

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
1. Four cold rooms are functional 2. Procured Five Hundred temperature monitoring (fridge tag-2)

target.value: Technical assistance to implement GAVI HSS 3 and Top up #2 activities: Objective 4,HTU-4(HSS)-Cold chain Tool kits for all 20 technicians; Objective 4,HR 54 (HSS) Procurement of temperature monitoring (fridge tag-2);Objective 4,HR-55(HSS) Procure 4 cold chain maintenance trucks (4X4).Objective 4,HR- 58 (HSS)Procurement of transport 4refridgerated mini vans; Objective 4,HTU-2(HSS)Procurement of 4 Cold rooms

comment.narrative: A private company namely Lao Industrial Solution has been recruited by UNICEF, which is the local agent of Haier Company in Laos, to install cold rooms. Team of MoH, UNICEF, and Lao conducted a pre-inspection visit in February and report prepared on the basis of which all shortcomings in newly renovated cold chain hubs have been eliminated. A total of 5 cold rooms, each 10m3 have been successfully installed in 4 geographical areas namely Luang Prabang, Vientiane Capital, Savannakhet, and Saravan provinces. Fridge tags are procured.

target.value: Technical assistance to implement GAVI HSS 3 and Top up #2 activities: Objective 4,HTU-4(HSS)-Cold chain Tool kits for all 20 technicians; Objective 4,HR 54 (HSS) Procurement of temperature monitoring (fridge tag-2);Objective 4,HR-55(HSS) Procure 4 cold chain maintenance trucks (4X4).Objective 4,HR- 58 (HSS)Procurement of transport 4refridgerated mini vans; Objective 4,HTU-2(HSS)Procurement of 4 Cold rooms

A total of 5 cold rooms, each 10m3 have been successfully installed in 4 geographical areas namely Luang Prabang, Vientiane Capital, Savannakhet, and Saravan provinces. Fridge tags are procured.

title.narrative: 1. Center of Excellence established and core team of 15 is trained on key competencies at national level; team consist of 3 people in each 18 provinces are trained in Immunization Supply Chain and Logistics (total of 70 staff) 2. Mentoring program established for supporting cascade training and coaching and supervision activities;

target.value: Develop Human Resources for an efficient and sustainable immunization Supply Chain & Logistics: 1.Build a pool of national and provincial trainers with enhanced training skills to impart effective competency-based training to lower levels; 2.Empower vaccine and cold chain manager at central, province and district level in skills in quality monitoring and supportive supervision to implement evidence-based coaching and supportive supervision across the lower levels; 3. Implement a comprehensive sustainable capacity building system composed of on-the-job trainings, coaching, supervision and monitoring for district and front-line health workers. (The activity is linked to Lao-German technical college with the team will build an alliance for incremental capacity building)

comment.narrative: Three national staff to support NIP and Central Store have been recruited. One Cold Chain Logistics, one Cold Chain Engineer, and one Cold Chain technician. The establishment of the Center of Excellence has been postponed till the completion of the CCEOP and Operational Deployment Plan. To get more detailed info on the needs of the Center of Excellence, the EVM2 assessment planned for 2022. To build a pool of national and provincial trainers to enhance skills, coaching and supervision a private company have been recruited which are currently engaged with NIP and regional team.

comment.narrative: 1. Technical and financial support provided in Q4 to conduct PIRI. Developed methodology to ID 50 priority districts based on Jan-Jun 2021 data factoring in ZD and undervaccinated children 2. Zero dose strategy drafted leveraging existing microplanning and QCM , which enable identification of zero dose children. Greater support for the existing components is required: microplan training, distribution of microplan guidelines, QCM and supportive supervision. Existing HSS grant should enable this 3. HPV PIE completed and recommendations for improving delivery of HPV vaccination (including integration with other services) shared and agreed with MOH

title.narrative: (1) Training materials are prepared based on the finalised national AEFI guidelines and tested in the field; (2) Annual AEFI review meeting is held and its minute is available

target.value: Vaccine safety and security (link to HR2-4, HR2-5): (1) strengthening AEFI surveillance and management at all levels; (2) development of AEFI workplan and convening of AEFI committee

comment.narrative: Vaccine safety and security: (1) national AEFI committee meeting was held on 05 and 10 of August 2021; An AEFI secretariate and technical meeting was held regularly, once every month and once a week, respectively. (2) National AEFI surveillance and management guidelines ? The National AEFI surveillance and management guidelines were drafted are being reviewed by NIP AEFI technical team. A consultation meeting is planned for December 2021

title.narrative: (1) At least 1 National AEFI Committee meeting held and its minute is available; (2) National AEFI surveillance and management guidelines finalised

target.value: Vaccine safety and security (link to HR2-4, HR2-5): (1) strengthening AEFI surveillance and management at all levels; (2) development of AEFI workplan and convening of AEFI committee

comment.narrative: in 2021, the AEFI committee has been very active meeting in Feb and May to review serious AEFI investigation and conduct causality assessments. The committee has reviewed and provided input on the national AEFI guideline, adding AEFI management to the guideline and an example of how to fill in the reporting form. WHO is providing technical support to expand capacity at the subnational level to complete thorough investigations and causality assessments.

title.narrative: WHO : Data
(1) AEFI data integrated in the DHIS2

target.value: HMIS (link to HSS activity HR-63,HR-3 to 7, HR-11 and HR-12) - Intensify the efforts to improve the quality and expanded use of data in DHIS2 down to health center level

comment.narrative: ? Aggregate AEFI data is now included in the data collection form. The new data also integrated in to DHIS2 system. Starting January 2021, HFs are entering this data in the system.

target.value: DATA QUALITY (link to HSS activities HR2-1, HR2-2. HR2-3, HR2-8, HR2-9, HR2-10): (1) Support revision of training materials and rollout EPI data managment training; (2) subnational data quality strengthening in # priority provinces; (3) Conduct data quality assessment (DQA) in # provinces per year; (4) support use of geospatial technologies for better planning of immunization activities to identify missed communities and zero dose children (5) Support development and implementation of EIR

comment.narrative: Detail implementation plan and budget prepared for EIR rollout, please find attached.

title.narrative: (1) Interactive dashboard developed for EPI; (2) SIA data integrated in the DHIS2

target.value: HMIS (link to HSS activity HR-63,HR-3 to 7, HR-11 and HR-12) - Intensify the efforts to improve the quality and expanded use of data in DHIS2 down to health center level

comment.narrative: o AEFI module integrated in to DHIS2 system (Both COVID and Routine Immunization). First round testing of the system conducted. The system will be ready for use mid of Nov 2021. - For the dashboard minor delay but for the SIA major delay. In the current upgraded version of DHIS2 there is new function called add filter and this can be used to make the dashboard interactive. Even we can use this function, filter province or district or HFs and, and can see their performance. But we had a plan also to update the content of the dashboard by including vaccine stock indicators using the data from the new HF vaccine stock monitoring module. We can include these indictors and update the dashboard before the end of this year.

title.narrative: (1) Pilot EIR in few districts (3 districts) (2) Data quality assessment conducted in two province (3) Primary geospatial data will be availabe from HFs and villages.

target.value: DATA QUALITY (link to HSS activities HR2-1, HR2-2. HR2-3, HR2-8, HR2-9, HR2-10): (1) Support revision of training materials and rollout EPI data managment training; (2) subnational data quality strengthening in # priority provinces; (3) Conduct data quality assessment (DQA) in # provinces per year; (4) support use of geospatial technologies for better planning of immunization activities to identify missed communities and zero dose children (5) Support development and implementation of EIR

comment.narrative: o Data Quality assessment: - Data quality assessment was conducted in two provinces, four districts and seven HFs. Feedback and on-the-job training provided based on the findings. o Electronics Immunization Registry:- Detail implementation plan and budget prepared o Geospatial Technology ? Detail implementation plan and budget prepared ? Existing data (secondary data) was compiled from different sources and cleaned for one province. The same activity continued for the remaining provinces. o Regular performance feedback: Regularly (monthly) performance feedback of routine immunization prepared and shared with the users.

title.narrative: CDC
Complete routine supportive supervision of ongoing STOP ISDS transisition activities and continue summative assessment of STOP ISDS pilot implementation

target.value: STOP Immunisation and Surveillance Data Specialist (ISDS) pilot transition, to ensure sustainable improvements in immunization and VPD surveillance data management, quality and use, through sustained supportive supervision

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Programme Management - LMC
ToRs and individual workplans developed for key staff members

target.value: Define roles and responsibilities of NIP staff members

comment.narrative: ? MCHC organigram has been finalized and mapped against core competencies and ToRs to highlight gaps, this is to inform support to NIP to define future EPI decision-making mechanisms. ? To present recommendations from the organogram mapping exercise to the NIP/MCHC by end of year. ? A workplan will be developed for 2022 skills transfer activities for 3-5 NIP individuals.

target.value: Define roles and responsibilities of NIP staff members

comment.narrative: MCHC organigram finalized, will be updated as required. ? Individual workplans for key staff members to be developed, linked to final 2021 AOP
